text: (SCRAPING)
Thursday afternoon in a 60 zone,

this 34-year-old motorcyclist
was on his way home.

It's our job to work out
why he never got there.

The rider broke his neck
on impact here...
(CRACK!)

..having crashed into this car
that was turning right.
By analysing the impact,

we know he hit the car
at 30km/h.

And these marks on the road tell us
that he skidded for 21m,
having braked hard here.
When he first reacted...
..he was doing 68.
But let's change one small thing.

At 60, the driver would have had
more chance to see him properly,
he'd have stayed in control

and reached this point
a moment later.

The car would have cleared his path
and he'd be home by now.
You decide on your speed.

The physics decides
whether you live or die.
